publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

seg.seg: Which monk digs up the earth with his own hand, or commands [somebody else] to dig it up—pātayantika.
Auf vier Monate, und [zwar] höchstens, darf ein Mönch eine persönliche Einladung annehmen. Nimmt er darüber hinaus an, [so ist das] ein Pātayantika[-Vergehen].
Over four months, and [that is] the highest, a monk may accept a personal invitation. If he accepts beyond that, [this is] a pātayantika [offence].

Whichever monk speaks as follows when the Prātimokṣasūtra is recited, «I don't act according to the word of you [pl.], fools, [but] I will ask who may know the vinaya and the abhidharma!», [commits] a pātayantika offence. 75
Wenn ein Mönch [wtl. welcher Mönch] lauschend [dabei]steht, wenn Mönche streiten [und] kä(mpfen), [so ist das] ein Pātayantika[-Vergehen].
If a monk [lit. whichever monk] stands listening when monks argue [and] fight, [this is] a pātayantika [offence].
Which monk ordains a person under twenty—pātayantika. He will not be [sbj.] ordained. The monks are all to be reproached.
Wenn sich ein Mönch [wtl. welcher Mönch], [wenn] von der Gemeinde eine Angelegenheit des Gesetzes entschieden wird, unerlaubt nach draußen erhebt, [so ist das] ein Pātayantika[-Vergehen].
If a monk [lit. whichever monk], [when] a matter of the law is decided by the community, rises [to go] outside without consent, [this is] a pātayantika [offence].

Wenn sich ein Mönch [wtl. welcher Mönch] eine Nadelbüchse aus Knochen [oder] Elfenbein macht, [so ist das] ein Pātayantika[-Vergehen]. Wenn sich ein Mönch einen Stuhl [oder] ein Bett macht, [so ist] nach Maß zu verfahren: ...
If a monk [lit. which[ever] monk] makes a needle container from bone [or] ivory, [this is] a Pātayantika [offence]. If a monk makes for himself a chair [or] a bed, this must be done by measure:

p.note: Although the left and right margins are lost, the leaf preserves almost the complete text. In lines a4 and b1, an indentation of about 2 akṣaras width is found.
aiykemane: ai is written as a with ai-vocalism
parrra: the rrr is a contamination of rr and the doubling stroke
mot māla trikelyesa śakse cf. b1
yaṣisa: ya is added under the line; the addition is marked with a cross above.

list.item:
a2. kṣalyi: miswritten for nakṣalyi

a3. wärpanar: miswritten for wärpanatär

a4. abhidhārm: r added later

a4. aiykemane: ai is written as a with ai-vocalism

b1. parrra: the rrr is a contamination of rr and the doubling stroke

b2. mot māla trikelyesa śakse cf. [[THT 1103]] b1

b3. yaṣisa: ya is added under the line; the addition is marked with a cross above.

a1 70 se ṣamāne lykaṃ wārṣeṃmpa plākisa ytāri yaṃ pāyti 70-1 se ṣamāne meṅki-ī_k_aṃ-pikwalaṃñepi onolmentse wasaṃpāt yama_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ pāyti su mā wasaṃpaṃnāk[e] – a2 ṣamāni kṣalyi 70-2 se ṣamāne ṣañ ṣarsa keṃ rapanaṃ rāpatsi wa_t\• wa_t_k_a_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ pāyti 70-3 śtwer meñtsa postaññe_ṣ\• ṣamānentse pudgalyi_k\• kāko wä – a3 -nalle tumeṃ olya wärpana_r\• pāyti 70-4 se ṣamāne prātimo_k_ṣ_a-sū_t_ar weskemane maṃt we_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ mā ñiś\• ye_s_añ\• aknātsaṃ_s\• rekisa yamaskau (–) a4 preku se sū_t_a_r\• winai abhidhā«r»_m\ aykemane tākaṃ pāyti 70-5 se ṣamāne śilnān_t_aṃ [w]e – – ṣamāneṃt_s\• klausa-pilṣi kalt[_r_a] pāyti 70-6 se ṣamāne (–) /// b1 saṅkantse pelaiykneṣṣe wäntare wätkau tākaṃ amplā_k_atte parra tseṅke_t_a_r\• pāyti 70-[7] – – ·[ā]ne pañäktentse maṣṣā_t\• yama_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ pāyti 70-8 se ṣa[m]· /// b2 mo_t\ māla trikelyesa śakse yo_k_aṃ pāyti 70-9 se ṣāmāne _k_atko_ṣ\ preke amplā_k_atte kwaṣaine yinma_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ pāyti 80 se ṣamāne nau_ṣ\• tsaṅka – /// b3 -sa pos_t_aṃ śinmalyñesa sāṅ_k\• miyi_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ pāyti 80-1 se ṣamāne yaka «ya»ṣisa lānte kercyenne yaṃ parna tu-yknesa _ṣ_armameṃ pāyti 80-2 k_use ṣamāne prā – /// b4 -mo_k_ṣ\• po āñmt·a mā klyau_ṣ_aṃ pāyti 80-3 se ṣamāne ayāṣṣe kemeṣṣe sucīkā_r\• yamas_t_a_r\• pāyti 80-4 se ṣamāne pir mañcā_k\• yamas_t[_r_a] yarmtsa yama_ṣ_alle pa- ///

a1 70 se ṣamāne lykaṃ wārṣeṃmpa plākisa ytāri yaṃ pāyti 71 se ṣamāne meṅki-īkäṃ-pikwalaṃñepi onolmentse wasaṃpāt yamaṣṣäṃ pāyti su mā wasaṃpaṃnāke – a2 ṣamāni «na»kṣalyi 72 se ṣamāne ṣañ ṣarsa keṃ rapanaṃ rāpatsi wat watkäṣṣäṃ pāyti 73 śtwer meñtsa postaññeṣ ṣamānentse pudgalyik kāko wärpanalle|wä(rpa)|nalle a3 tumeṃ olya wärpana«tä»r pāyti 74 se ṣamāne prātimokṣä-sūtär weskemane mant|maṃt weṣṣäṃ mā ñiś yesäñ aknātsaṃs rekisa yamaskau (–) a4 preku se sūtär winai abhidhārm aikemane|aykemane tākaṃ pāyti 75 se ṣamāne śilnāntäṃ we(tāntäṃ) ṣamāneṃts klausa-pilṣi kalträ pāyti 76 se ṣamāne (–) b1 saṅkantse pelaikneṣṣe|pelaiykneṣṣe wäntare wätkau tākaṃ amplākätte parna|parra tseṅketär pāyti 77 (se ṣam)āne pañäktentse maṣṣāt yamaṣṣäṃ pāyti 78 se ṣam(āne) b2 mot māla trikelyesa śakse yokäṃ pāyti 79 se ṣamāne|ṣāmāne kätkoṣ preke amplākätte kwaṣaine yinmaṣṣäṃ pāyti 80 se ṣamāne nauṣ tsaṅkalyñesa|tsaṅka(lyñe)|sa b3 postäṃ śinmalyñesa sāṅk miyiṣṣäṃ pāyti 81 se ṣamāne yaka yaṣisa lānte kercyenne yaṃ parna tu-yknesa ṣärmameṃ pāyti 82 k_use ṣamāne prātimokṣ|prā(ti)|mokṣ b4 po āñmt(s)a mā klyauṣäṃ pāyti 83 se ṣamāne ayāṣṣe kemeṣṣe sucīkār yamastär pāyti 84 se ṣamāne pir mañcāk yamasträ yarmtsa yamaṣṣälle|yamaṣälle pañäktentse|pa(ñä|ktentse)
Although the left and right margins are lost, the leaf preserves almost the complete text. In lines a4 and b1, an indentation of about 2 akṣaras width is found.

Alternative classifications:
Peyrotclassical ~ late
Malzahn–
Tamai–
Tamai-C14–

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a2 Which monk digs up the earth with his own hand, or commands [somebody else] to dig it up—pātayantika. 333
a3-4 Whichever monk speaks as follows when the Prātimokṣasūtra is recited, «I don't act according to the word of you [pl.], fools, [but] I will ask who may know the vinaya and the abhidharma!», [commits] a pātayantika offence. 75 703
a4-b1 Which monk ordains a person under twenty—pātayantika. He will not be [sbj.] ordained. The monks are all to be reproached. 333


Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a2-3 Auf vier Monate, und [zwar] höchstens, darf ein Mönch eine persönliche Einladung annehmen. Nimmt er darüber hinaus an, [so ist das] ein Pātayantika[-Vergehen]. 201-2
a4 Wenn ein Mönch [wtl. welcher Mönch] lauschend [dabei]steht, wenn Mönche streiten [und] kä(mpfen), [so ist das] ein Pātayantika[-Vergehen]. 272
a4-b1 Wenn sich ein Mönch [wtl. welcher Mönch], [wenn] von der Gemeinde eine Angelegenheit des Gesetzes entschieden wird, unerlaubt nach draußen erhebt, [so ist das] ein Pātayantika[-Vergehen]. 282
b4 Wenn sich ein Mönch [wtl. welcher Mönch] eine Nadelbüchse aus Knochen [oder] Elfenbein macht, [so ist das] ein Pātayantika[-Vergehen]. Wenn sich ein Mönch einen Stuhl [oder] ein Bett macht, [so ist] nach Maß zu verfahren: ... 425-6


Translation from [[Meunier 2013]]: 170:
a1 lequel moine accorde l'ordination à un être qui a moins de vingt ans - pātayantika; celui-ci n'[est] pas un être ayant obtenu l'ordination.


Translation from [[Ogihara 2009]]: 245:
a1 70 If a monk goes on one way through agreement with thieves (and) robbers, Pāt. 71 If a monk does the ordination to a man under twenty years old, Pāt. This (man) will not be ordained. (These)
a2 monks should be blamed. 72 If a monk digs the earth with his own hand or orders to dig, Pāt. 73. At most for four months, a monk shall enjoy a personal invitation.
a3 If he enjoys it more than that, Pāt. 74 If a monk, when the Prātimokṣasūtra is recited, says in this way, 'I will not do according to the preach of you who are foolish.
a4 I will ask the one who knows Sūtra, Vinaya and Abhidharma'. Pāt. 75 If a monk stands with ears attentive to quarreling and [fighting] monks, Pāt. 76 If a monk, when
b1 a matter of law is being decided by the community, stands without permission, Pāt. 7[7] [If a monk] scorns the Buddha-lord, Pāt. 78 If [a monk]
b2 drinks alcohol made from cereals, alcohol made from fruits or flowers, and alcohol with intoxication, Pāt. 79 If a monk enters into a village when the time has passed without permission, Pāt. 80 If a monk embarrasses the community
b3 by an early departure or by a late arrival, Pāt. 81 If a monk goes to the palace of a king still at night, except for such a reason, Pāt. 82 If a monk
b4 does not hear Prātimokṣa with all soul, Pāt. 83 If a monk makes a needlecase made of bone and tooth, Pāt. 84 If a monk makes a chair and a couch, it should be made according to the size [of Budha]


Translation according to [[Broomhead I]]: 80:
a1 70. Whichever monk goes on [his] way with thieves and robbers, [commits] pāyti. 71. Whichever monk carries out the consecration of a person under twenty years old, [commits] pāyti. This person shall not be [considered] consecrated
a2 [and] the monks are to blame. 72. Whichever monk digs the ground with his own hand or orders [another] to dig, [commits] pāyti. 73. For four months at the outside can a monk accept a personal invitation, indeed, and
a3 should he accept for over and above [that period] [commits] pāyti. 74. Whichever monk, when the Prātimokṣa sūtra is being recited speaks thus:- "I shall not act on the word of you ignorant ones
a4 [but] I shall ask [those] who know the Vinaya [and] Abhidharma" [commits] pāyti. 75. Whichever monks stands [near] fighting [and] quarreling monks, [as one] pricking [his] ears, [commits] pāyti. 76. Whichever monk,
b1 when an affair of the community is being decided, stands up without permission, [commits] pāyti. 7(7) (Whichever mo)nk shows disrespect for the Buddha [commits] pāyti. 78. Whichever mo(nk)
b2 with alcohol maireya [and] intoxicants drinks brandy, [commits] pāyti. 79. Whichever monk enter a village without permission, when the time is past [commits] pāyti. 80. Whichever monk through early-rising [and] late-coming
b3 harms the community [commits] pāyti. 81. Whichever monk goes to the king's palace [while it is] still night, without a good excuse [commits] pāyti. 82. Whichever monk
b4 does not listen to the Prātimokṣa sūtra with his whole heart [commits] pāyti. 83. Whichever monk makes a needle-box out of bone [or] ivory, [commits] pāyti. 84. Whichever monk makes a chair [and] a bed, must make [it] according to the measure, of the Buddha [gap of ca. 10 letters - TI] [commits] pāyti. 85.


[[Broomhead I]]: 81 contains further notes on text and translation.

div.p:
Alternative classifications:

Translation from <citedRange>170</citedRange></bibl>: a1 lequel moine accorde l'ordination à un être qui a moins de vingt ans - pātayantika; celui-ci n'[est] pas un être ayant obtenu l'ordination.</p><p>Translation from <bibl><title corresp="ref:ogihara2009"/><citedRange>245</citedRange></bibl>: a1 70 If a monk goes on one way through agreement with thieves (and) robbers, Pāt. 71 If a monk does the ordination to a man under twenty years old, Pāt. This (man) will not be ordained. (These) a2 monks should be blamed. 72 If a monk digs the earth with his own hand or orders to dig, Pāt. 73. At most for four months, a monk shall enjoy a personal invitation. a3 If he enjoys it more than that, Pāt. 74 If a monk, when the Prātimokṣasūtra is recited, says in this way, 'I will not do according to the preach of you who are foolish. a4 I will ask the one who knows Sūtra, Vinaya and Abhidharma'. Pāt. 75 If a monk stands with ears attentive to quarreling and [fighting] monks, Pāt. 76 If a monk, when b1 a matter of law is being decided by the community, stands without permission, Pāt. 7[7] [If a monk] scorns the Buddha-lord, Pāt. 78 If [a monk] b2 drinks alcohol made from cereals, alcohol made from fruits or flowers, and alcohol with intoxication, Pāt. 79 If a monk enters into a village when the time has passed without permission, Pāt. 80 If a monk embarrasses the community b3 by an early departure or by a late arrival, Pāt. 81 If a monk goes to the palace of a king still at night, except for such a reason, Pāt. 82 If a monk b4 does not hear Prātimokṣa with all soul, Pāt. 83 If a monk makes a needlecase made of bone and tooth, Pāt. 84 If a monk makes a chair and a couch, it should be made according to the size [of Budha]</p><p>Translation according to <bibl><title corresp="ref:broomhead1962"/><citedRange>80</citedRange></bibl>: a1 70. Whichever monk goes on [his] way with thieves and robbers, [commits] pāyti. 71. Whichever monk carries out the consecration of a person under twenty years old, [commits] pāyti. This person shall not be [considered] consecrated a2 [and] the monks are to blame. 72. Whichever monk digs the ground with his own hand or orders [another] to dig, [commits] pāyti. 73. For four months at the outside can a monk accept a personal invitation, indeed, and a3 should he accept for over and above [that period] [commits] pāyti. 74. Whichever monk, when the Prātimokṣa sūtra is being recited speaks thus:- "I shall not act on the word of you ignorant ones a4 [but] I shall ask [those] who know the Vinaya [and] Abhidharma" [commits] pāyti. 75. Whichever monks stands [near] fighting [and] quarreling monks, [as one] pricking [his] ears, [commits] pāyti. 76. Whichever monk, b1 when an affair of the community is being decided, stands up without permission, [commits] pāyti. 7(7) (Whichever mo)nk shows disrespect for the Buddha [commits] pāyti. 78. Whichever mo(nk) b2 with alcohol maireya [and] intoxicants drinks brandy, [commits] pāyti. 79. Whichever monk enter a village without permission, when the time is past [commits] pāyti. 80. Whichever monk through early-rising [and] late-coming b3 harms the community [commits] pāyti. 81. Whichever monk goes to the king's palace [while it is] still night, without a good excuse [commits] pāyti. 82. Whichever monk b4 does not listen to the Prātimokṣa sūtra with his whole heart [commits] pāyti. 83. Whichever monk makes a needle-box out of bone [or] ivory, [commits] pāyti. 84. Whichever monk makes a chair [and] a bed, must make [it] according to the measure, of the Buddha [gap of ca. 10 letters - TI] [commits] pāyti. 85. </p><p><bibl><title corresp="ref:broomhead1962"/><citedRange>81</citedRange></bibl> contains further notes on text and translation.</p></project_comment>
